inclusion.criterion: newly diagnosed acromegaly due to GH-secreting macro-adenomas
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: newly diagnosed, previously untreated patients with GH nadir more than 2.5 μg/L during a standard 75-g, 2-h oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: pituitary macroadenomas (maximum diameter >1 cm) verified by a pituitary magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: immediate surgery indicated by clinical criteria
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients judged not suitable to participate in the study for other reasons such as personality disorders and alcohol abuse.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 41-year-old man with known Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. His lab studies show IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age, and random GH level is 4 ug/L.
